Title: Hoegh Gannet FSRU to return to Brunsbuttel LNG terminal next week
Description: The 170,000 m3 Hoegh Gannet floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) will return to Germany’s LNG terminal in Brunsbuttel next week, with the exact time depending mostly on weather conditions and coordination with other ships coming to unload their cargos. Brunsbuttel is the third LNG terminal to be launched in Germany this winter to help replace the lost Russian pipeline supplies.
Author: DE

Title: India’s GSPC makes second attempt to buy a second-half March LNG cargo
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum has issued a tender again to buy one cargo for delivery in the second half of March to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on Feb. 13.
Author: CK

Title: Merakes gas project partners offer three-year supply of LNG from Bontang from 2024
Description: The partners in Indonesia’s Merakes gas field project are selling a total of 83 trillion Btu of LNG on a free-on-board basis from the 11.5 mtpa Bontang LNG plant in Kalimantan over a three-year period from 2024 to 2026. The tender closes on Feb. 23.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG gets FERC’s approval to begin ship loadings
Description: Freeport has received approval from the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to resume load cargoes onto ships at its first dock, bringing the plant closer to beginning production and exports of LNG cargoes from its idled 15 mtpa LNG plant on Quintana Island in Texas.
Author: CK
